description:
MongoDB Prometheus Exporter Dashboard. 
Works well with https://github.com/dcu/mongodb_exporter

If you have the node_exporter running on the mongo instance, you will also get some useful alert panels related to disk io and cpu.

panels.description:
**mysql 运行状态**

mysql up/ 运行状态
panels.title: 运行状态

panels.description: mongodb_memory The mem data structure holds information regarding the target system architecture of mongod and current memory use

links.title: Tuning the InnoDB Buffer Pool Size

panels.title: 虚拟内存使用量

panels.description: mongodb_memory The mem data structure holds information regarding the target system architecture of mongod and current memory use
panels.title: 物理内存使用量

panels.description: See which node is currently acting as the primary, secondary, ...
panels.title: Member State

alert.message:
A MongoDB oplog replication has been 5 minutes behind in its replication for more than 15 minutes.
Being able to fail over to a replica of your data is only useful if the data is up to date, so you need to know when that’s no longer the case!
alert.name: MongoDB Oplog lag alert

alert.message: MongoDB's average disk i/o utilization has been above 98% for 5 minutes
alert.name: MongoDB's Disk IO Utilization alert

panels.description: When used in combination with 'Command Operations', this graph can help identify write amplification. For example, when one insert or update command actually inserts or updates hundreds, thousands, or even millions of documents.
panels.title: Document Operations

panels.description: This is useful for write-heavy workloads to understand how long it takes to verify writes and how many concurrent writes are occurring.
panels.title: getLastError Write Time

panels.description: This is useful for write-heavy workloads to understand how long it takes to verify writes and how many concurrent writes are occurring.
panels.title: getLastError Write Operations

panels.description: Any number of queued operations for long periods of time is an indication of possible issues. Find the cause and fix it before requests get stuck in the queue.
panels.title: Queued Operations

panels.description: Helps identify why connections are increasing. Shows active cursors compared to cursors being automatically killed after 10 minutes due to an application not closing the connection.
panels.title: Cursors

title: MongoDB
